name: Breathing Exercises
description: Breathwork for calm, focus, and recovery

exercises.name: Box Breathing
exercises.description: 4-4-4-4 breathing pattern for calm and focus
exercises.instructions: Breathe in for 4 counts. Hold for 4 counts. Breathe out for 4 counts. Hold empty for 4 counts. Repeat. Focus entirely on the count.

exercises.name: 4-7-8 Breathing
exercises.description: Relaxation breath for sleep and anxiety
exercises.instructions: Breathe in through nose for 4 counts. Hold for 7 counts. Exhale slowly through mouth for 8 counts, making a whoosh sound. Repeat cycle.

exercises.name: Diaphragmatic Breathing
exercises.description: Belly breathing for relaxation and core connection
exercises.instructions: Place one hand on chest, one on belly. Breathe in through nose, expanding belly (not chest). Exhale slowly, feeling belly fall. Chest stays relatively still.

modifications.harder: Practice while standing or during gentle movement

exercises.name: Physiological Sigh
exercises.description: Fastest way to calm down in real-time
exercises.instructions: Take a deep breath in through nose. At the top, take a second short sip of air to fully expand lungs. Then exhale slowly and fully through mouth. Repeat 2-3 times.

exercises.name: Alternate Nostril Breathing
exercises.description: Balancing breath for calm and mental clarity
exercises.instructions: Close right nostril with thumb, inhale through left. Close left nostril with ring finger, exhale through right. Inhale through right, close, exhale through left. That's one cycle.
exercises.videoSearch: alternate nostril breathing nadi shodhana yoga

exercises.name: Energising Breath
exercises.description: Quick breaths to boost energy and alertness
exercises.instructions: Take 20-30 quick, sharp breaths through the nose, pumping the belly. Then take a deep breath in, hold for 10-15 seconds, exhale slowly. Repeat 2-3 rounds.

modifications.easier: Fewer breaths per round (15), shorter holds
modifications.harder: More breaths per round, longer holds
